com.cmart.util

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cmart.util.Item

  • public class Item
extends java.lang.Object
    This object hold and item read from the data base. As setting the data to the object here doesn't change it in the data base it should really be immutable. However, since we can make the code more efficient by only reading and setting the values we need, and using the 'set' methods for temporary storage it is better for performance to not use this as immutable. Whichever way we choose someone will complain
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andy (andrewtu@cmu.edu)

        @Deprecated
private static void printWarning()
        Deprecated.
